abstract: Ashley Parker discusses the final leg of Mitt Romney’s trip to Europe and Israel, Erik Olsen on the youngest “super-pac,” Shaila Deway on single women voters, and Jim Roberts with Andrew Kaczynski of Buzzfeed on what happens if Twitter goes down.

abstract: The app, available on Tuesday, allows supporters of President Obama to download names of people in their neighborhood from the campaign’s central database.
snippet: The app, available on Tuesday, allows supporters of President Obama to download names of people in their neighborhood from the campaign’s central database.
lead_paragraph: It’s been the science-fiction dream of political operatives for years: an army of volunteers, connected to the Internet as they walk from door to door, looking up names on a device and entering their responses electronically.

headline.main: Obama Campaign Releases iPhone App for Canvassing

abstract: A Republican Senate runoff has pitted a magnetic Tea Party conservative with no elective experience against the lieutenant governor.
snippet: A Republican Senate runoff has pitted a magnetic Tea Party conservative with no elective experience against the lieutenant governor.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — It may be the armadillo days of summer in Texas, but a runoff vote on Tuesday for the Republican Senate nomination has jolted the party establishment here and around the country as a magnetic Tea Party conservative with no elective experience gains momentum against the chosen candidate of Gov. Rick Perry.

headline.main: A Runoff Is Down to the Wire in Texas
